thread.title: Deal watch: Norwegian Cruise Line touts new offer
thread.title_full: Deal watch: Norwegian Cruise Line touts new offer

title: Deal watch: Norwegian Cruise Line touts new offer
text:
Head to the sunshine in Belize City, Costa Maya and Cozumel, Mexico and Roatan, Honduras, from Tampa, on Norwegian Cruise Line's Norwegian Sun. (Photo: Norwegian Cruise Line)
24 CONNECT 5 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Norwegian Cruise Line is back with another Freestyle Choice promotion for the month of October that brings free perks with new bookings.
The Miami-based operator says customers who book a cruise of three to 16 nights can choose from one of four value-added options that include a free Specialty Dining Package, free Ultimate Beverage Package or 250-minute wifi package.
The fourth option is a $50-per-port shore excursion credit in up to four ports.
The offer is for sailings on or before April 30. Customers who book a cruise that begins on or after May 1 can choose one of the above options if sailing in a balcony cabin or suite. Those in less-expensive cabins have a choice of several lesser perks.
USA TODAY
First look: Inside Norwegian Cruise Line's giant new ship
Norwegian also is offering customers who book a South America cruise on the Norwegian Sun on select dates an on-board credit of $100.
Norwegian's Specialty Dining Package includes dinners at specialty restaurants that normally come with an extra charge. The Ultimate Beverage Package includes wine, beer and cocktails.
For a deck-by-deck look at Norwegian's newest ship, the Norwegian Getaway, click through the carousel below.
Norwegian Cruise Line's newest ship, the 4.028-passenger Norwegian Getaway, set sail with passengers for the first time on Jan. 11, 2014. What's the vessel like? USA TODAY's Gene Sloan offers a photo tour. Norwegian Cruise Line Fullscreen Built at the Meyer Werft shipyard in Papenburg, Germany, the 146,000-ton Norwegian Getaway is a sister to the nine-month-old Norwegian Breakaway and shares the same basic design. Norwegian Cruise Line Fullscreen As with the Norwegian Breakaway, the hub of the Norwegian Getaway's top deck areas is the Aqua Park, a family-friendly fun zone that is home to five multi-story waterslides. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located on Deck 15, the Aqua Park also is home to several pools and a watery play area for small children. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Aqua Park's water play area for kids has a SpongeBob theme. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Norwegian Getaway's main pool is flanked with two covered hot tubs, and there are two more hot tubs nearby. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A close-up of the Getaway's main pool area, which has a stage for live musical performances. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The five water slides at the Norwegian Getaway's Aqua Park include the Whip, a pair of side-by-side twister slides. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen More areas for lounging atop the Norwegian Getaway can be found on Deck 16. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Vibe Beach Club on Deck 16 is an extra-charge, adults-only oasis with its own hot tub, lounge chairs and full-service bar. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen An area of lounge chairs at the Norwegian Getaway's Vibe Beach Club. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Norwegian Breakaway's top deck also is home to a rock-climbing wall. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located at the back of the ship, Spice H20 is an adult-only lounge area by day and an outdoor dance club by night. It boasts two hot tubs, a waterfall, full-service bar and a giant video screen. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A three-story sports complex located just behind the ship's main funnel includes the line's second outdoor ropes course. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Norwegian Getaway's ropes course rivals the one on Norwegian Breakaway for the title of largest at sea. The multi-level structure features more than 40 elements, including a zip track. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located underneath part of the ropes course on Norwegian Getaway is a nine-hole miniature golf course. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Norwegian Getaway's sports deck also is home to a bungee trampoline. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen New on Norwegian Getaway is The Grammy Experience, a live entertainment venue developed in partnership with The Grammy Museum. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Grammy Experience is home to live entertainment that will include regular performances by Grammy-winning and Grammy-nominated artists. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Cases in The Grammy Experience showroom display costumes worn by Grammy-winning artists. Here, outfits that once belonged to the Jackson Five. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Norwegian Getaway offers more than a dozen full-service restaurants, including Brazilian-style steakhouse Moderno Churrascaria. The $20-a-person eatery's specialty is grilled and slow-roasted meats that are carved tableside by passadors. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Adjacent to Moderno Churrascaria on Deck 8 is Cagney's Steakhouse, a Norwegian signature that costs $30 per person. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located between Cagney's and Moderno is the circular Prime Meridian Bar. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Deck 8 Waterfront features outdoor seating areas for a number of restaurants and bars, including Moderno Churrascaria. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Deck 8 also is home to a shopping area with jewelry, clothing and Norwegian Cruise Line-related items. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A circular opening on the Norwegian Getaway provides a visual connection -- and stairway access -- between the restaurants and nightspots of Decks 6, 7 and 8. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen New on the Norwegian Getaway is the mojito-serving Sugarcane Mojito Bar. It fills a central location on Deck 8 that is home to a martini bar on the Norwegian Breakaway. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like other Norwegian Cruise Line ships, Norwegian Getaway has a sushi eatery called Wasabi. Prices are a la carte. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like sister ship Norwegian Breakaway, Norwegian Getaway houses a $49-a-person seafood eatery run by Food Network star Geoffrey Zakarian called Ocean Blue. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Adjacent to Ocean Blue is another Geoffrey Zakarian eatery, the Raw Bar. Prices are a la carte. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen New on Norwegian Getaway is the Ernest Hemingway-inspired Sunset Bar. It's located where the Maltings Bar can be found on Norwegian Breakaway. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen More than 50 electronic screens around the ship allow passengers to make bookings for restaurants and shows -- a concept that first debuted on the Norwegian Breakaway. The screens also offer general information about venues around the ship as well as easy-to-follow directions. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located on Deck 8, La Cucina serves Tuscany-inspired Italian dishes. It costs $15 per person. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen In addition to interior seating (shown here), La Cucina has an outdoor seating area along the ship's the Deck 8 "Waterfront." By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Tropicana Room on Deck 7 features a large dance floor as a focal point and is the site of live music and dancing during meals. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Among the entertainment in The Tropicana Room is a 'Burn the Floor' ballroom dancing show. Here, the room's dance floor is shown set up for a presentation. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like the Norwegian Breakaway, Norwegian Getaway has a stylish, contemporary decor that extends to the ship's hallways, including elevator areas. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Getaway Casino on Deck 7 is home to more than 300 slot machines and 26 gaming tables offering poker, black jack, roulette and craps. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A table game area at the Getaway Casino. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen O'Sheehan's, a pub-like sports bar and grill that first debuted on Norwegian Epic in 2010, is back in a similar form on Norwegian Getaway. It serves fish and chips, burgers and other classic pub food. Amusements include miniature bowling, pool and interactive arcade games. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen O'Sheehan's, a pub-like sports bar and grill that first debuted on Norwegian Epic in 2010, is back in a similar form on Norwegian Getaway. It serves fish and chips, burgers and other classic pub food. Amusements include miniature bowling, pool and interactive arcade games. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen O'Sheehan's offers two lanes of miniature bowling. It costs $5 to play. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A pool table at O'Sheehan's. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen One of several interactive arcade games located at O'Sheehan's. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like Norwegian Breakaway, Norwegian Getaway has a dedicated noodle called Shanghai's. Prices are a la carte. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Norwegian Getaway's Getaway Theatre houses the former Broadway show 'Legally Blonde.' By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen New on Norwegian Getaway is The Illusionarium, a dedicated space that is the site of a magic-infused dinner show. It costs $39 per person. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The shore excursions desk, located on Deck 6. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A popular meeting point on the ship is The Bar at the Atrium, located at the bottom of the ship's three-deck-high atrium near the Guest Services desk. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A large open seating area at the base of the atrium on Deck 6 faces a giant screen that is used to show live sporting events and other entertainment. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Also at the base of Getaway's atrium is the Atrium Cafe. which features baked goods from "Cake Boss" star Buddy Valastro's Carlo's Bakery. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen An art gallery area is an element of Deck 6. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Le Bistro, Norwegian's signature French restaurant, is back on Norwegian Getaway with indoor seating as well as "atrium al fresco" seating outside the restaurant. It costs $20 per person. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located on Deck 6 is Taste, which offers traditional cuisine with a contemporary flair. There is no extra charge to dine. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The main seating area within the restaurant Taste. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The most luxurious of the 2,014 cabins on Norwegian Getaway are the 42 suites found inside The Haven, a private enclave at the top of the ship. Here, the living area of an Owner's Suite. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Owner's Suites feature a bedroom with a king-size bed, a separate living room with dining area, and a large modern bathroom with separate shower and tub. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Among the many amenities found in Haven suites are specialty coffee machines. Owner's Suites also come with concierge and butler service. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Owner's Suite bathrooms have double sinks as well as walk-in showers and large tubs. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Owner's Suites also feature a large amount of storage space, including walk-in closets. The cabins can sleep up to four. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Even larger than Owner's Suites are the ship's two Deluxe Owner's Suites, which measure 936 square feet and sleep up to four. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Bedrooms in the two Deluxe Owner's Suites feature king-size beds that face floor-to-ceiling windows and an extra-spacious wraparound private balcony. Each of the Deluxe Owner's Suites can be joined with an Owner's Suite to create a grand suite that sleeps up to eight people. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Deluxe Owner's Suite bathrooms have an oversized bath tub, two modern vanity sinks and a large shower. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The tub area in a Deluxe Owner's Suite bathroom. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Deluxe Owner's Suites have large walk-in closet areas. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven also is home to 18 Haven Courtyard Penthouses. At 334 square feet, they are smaller than Owner's Suites but still significantly larger than standard cabins. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located near the Haven's private courtyard, the Haven Courtyard Penthouses have bedrooms with king-size beds, and a small living and dining area. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A Haven Courtyard Penthouse balcony. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A Haven Courtyard Penthouse bathroom. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Another high-end option on the Norwegian Getaway are its 20 Haven Family Villas, which have two bedrooms and two bathrooms. They measure 559 square feet and sleep up to six people. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Family Villa's master bath has a large shower, an oversized oval tub that looks out to the sea and two modern vanity sinks. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Haven Family Villas have a separate living room and dining area that includes a pull-out sofa bed, writing desk and bar. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The second bedrooms in Haven Family Villas have a double pull-out sofa bed that is connected to its own bathroom. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The second bathroom of a Haven Family Villa. Like all Haven cabins, the villas come with a private concierge and 24-hour butler. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The most common category of cabin on the Norwegian Getaway are its Balcony Staterooms, of which there are 960. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The 204-square-foot Balcony Staterooms have queen beds that can be converted into two twin beds and feature a clean, contemporary design. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Balcony Staterooms have large, streamlined bathrooms with plenty of lighting. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Balcony Stateroom bathrooms have a shower but no tub. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen More storage is available in large drawers under the sofas in Balcony Staterooms. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The desk area of a Balcony Stateroom has four electrical outlets, two on a U.S. standard and two on a European standard. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen All cabin categories - including Balcony Staterooms, shown here - come with a mini-bar. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The balconies for Balcony Staterooms have two chairs and a small table. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Balcony Staterooms have large closets that feature areas for hanging clothes, shelves and a safe. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A look inside the closet of a Balcony Stateroom. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Norwegian Getaway has 449 windowless inside cabins that have two twin beds that can be converted into a queen. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Many of the inside cabins have pull-down bunks and can sleep up to four people. They have small desk areas and televisions, and measure 151 square feet. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Inside cabin bathrooms are similar to those found in balcony cabins. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Norwegian Getaway also has 120 oceanview cabins that have windows but no balconies. Here, what's billed as a Family Oceanview Stateroom. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Family Oceanview Staterooms measure 161 square feet and have two twin beds that can convert into a queen. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The twelve Haven Penthouses measure 505 square feet and have a bedroom with king-size bed and a separate living room. The cabin category is different than the Haven Courtyard Penthouse. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The living room of a Haven Penthouse has a double sofa bed, writing desk and dining area. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Haven Penthouse bathrooms have two bowl sinks, a curved oval bathtub and separate shower. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen There are 248 Mini Suites on the Norwegian Getaway. The 236-square-foot cabins are slightly larger than standard Balcony Staterooms. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Mini Suites have a king-size bed that can be separated to form two smaller beds, a large closet, a sofa bed with additional storage and a built-in desk area. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like standard Balcony Staterooms, Mini Suites have coffee makers. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The biggest difference between a Mini Suite and a Balcony Stateroom is that Mini Suites have bigger and more elaborate bathrooms. Mini Suite bathrooms have a large double sink with two faucets set against a mosaic glass-tile backsplash, additional storage space under the sink and a larger shower than Balcony Staterooms. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The showers in Mini Suite bathrooms feature rain-shower heads and multiple body spray jets. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Mini Suite balconies have two chairs and a small table. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Getaway's video arcade is located near the ship's teen center on Deck 16. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Getaway's video arcade offers a wide range of games, all with an extra charge. By Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like this topic?
